meanings.sent1: The scientist studied a hydrogenous compound in the lab.
meanings.sent2: The hydrogenous fuel cell powered the car efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The hydrogenous bubbles in the fizzy drink made it extra refreshing.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a hydrogenous explosion, filling the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The hydrogenous smell of the gas was unmistakable in the air.

meanings.definition: Relating to or derived from hydrogen.
meanings.sent1: The hydrogenous properties of the element were fascinating to the students.
meanings.sent2: The scientist explained the hydrogenous origin of the star's energy.
meanings.sent3: The hydrogenous balloon floated gracefully in the sky, carrying a message.
meanings.sent4: His words had a hydrogenous quality, sparking inspiration in the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The hydrogenous taste of the water indicated its purity.
